net.java.jddac.common.type
Class LocationJ2me

java.lang.Object
  net.java.jddac.common.type.Location
      net.java.jddac.common.type.LocationJ2me
All Implemented Interfaces:
ArgArray.ArgConverter
public class LocationJ2me
extends Location

J2ME version of repreentation of geographic location. Values are stored as 36e6 ticks per degree or 10000 ticks per second.

See Also:
Location

Field Detail

ticksPerDegree

public static final long ticksPerDegree
ticksPerDegree represents the number of 'counts' in one degree of latitude or longitude. This is used internally to scale and convert values and is also available externally for use with the setLocation method with long arguments.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

setLocation

public void setLocation(long _latitude,
                        long _longitude,
                        int _altitude,
                        int _fix,
                        TimeRepresentation _timeStamp)
Set the value of a LocationJ2me instance using scaled long values. Values are scaled according to the ticksPerDegree member variable.

Parameters:
_latitude - - the latitude.
_longitude - - the longitude.
_altitude - - the altutude in meters.
_fix - - the fix state.
_timeStamp - - the timestamp of the location.

convert

public static LocationJ2me convert(Location loc)
Given a Location instance, convert it to an instance of LocationJ2me. If the object is already an instance of LocationJ2me then it is returned and a new object is not created.

Parameters:
loc - - the object to convert.
Returns:
- an instance of LocationJ2me.
